metadata.Title: CVE-2020-3885 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixedin iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, tvOS 13.4, Safari 13.1, iTunes for Windows12.10.5, iCloud for Windows 10.9.3, iCloud for Windows 7.18. A file URL maybe incorrectly processed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-3885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
